channel.title: Stupid USA Laws

item.description:

It is legal to drive the wrong way on a one way street if you have a lantern on the front of your car. [Thanks to an anonymous contributor]

I’m doing this.

item.title: Stupid USA Laws
item.dc:creator: @revengr revengr
item.description:
@revengr wrote:

[quote=“shrogg, post:4, topic:343705”]South Dakota

No horses are allowed into Fountain Inn unless they are wearing pants.
It is illegal to lie down and fall asleep in a cheese factory.

Washington:

All lollipops are banned.
In Bellingham it is illegal for a woman to take any steps that are not in the backwards direction while dancing.[/quote]
Rofl

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid USA Laws
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Pennsylvania:

In Tarentum,Pennsylvania it is illegal to tie horses to parking meters.

Shit, I literally live 5 minutes walking away from there >.> Sad part is, there is no place to house a horse in Tarentum :
(btw its pronounced Trentum, so many people fuck that up lol).

Any motorist driving along a country road at night must stop every mile and send up a rocket signal, wait 10 minutes for the road to be cleared of livestock, and continue.

I have actually done that to be a dick.

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid USA Laws
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

New York(i live here)

1) A fine of $25 can be levied for flirting. This old law specifically prohibits men from turning around on any city street and looking "at a woman in that way." A second conviction for a crime of this magnitude calls for the violating male to be forced to wear a "pair of horse-blinders" wherever and whenever he goes outside for a stroll. 2) Jumping off a building is punishable by death (this includes the Empire State building). 3) It is illegal to shoot a rabbit from a moving trolley.

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid USA Laws
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

It is illegal for a woman to drive a car unless there is a man either running or walking in front of it waving a red flag to warn approaching motorists and pedestrians.

Sexism prevails once again.

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid USA Laws
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

This aren’t laws. These are common sense. The only reason they get put in jail/fined for these is because they are obviously going to hurt someone, or cause annoyance.

It also did say few were fake so XD

But the cop must be a pretty bad cop to take em in.

Most of these are fake

I live in TN and this is fake.

It is illegal for a woman to drive a car unless there is a man either running or walking in front of it waving a red flag to warn approaching motorists and pedestrians.

False. I have frogs outside my house (I live near a pond)

it's illegal for frogs to croak after 11 p.m.

Well this pie one is obviously a lie.

It is illegal to give any pie to fellow diners. It is also illegal to take unfinished pie home. All pie must be eaten on the premises.

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid USA Laws
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:11, topic:343705”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=440096.msg3233973#msg3233973 date=1276329656]

I live in Washington, and I know none of those are real laws.

Do you know none of them are real, or is it the fact they are not enforced anymore. Most of the laws on that list are just not enforced anymore, but are real laws.

http://www.ahajokes.com/laws047.html
From just ‘streaming’ around, I found another one, with even the lollipop law.

Another, with even more Washington laws.
http://www.pugetsoundoff.org/blog/kat/4387

Please, I would get a list of current Washington laws before accusing this. Every state has stupid laws. Just because you live there, and have done some of them, does not mean its not illegal, its just that it is not enforced anymore.
[/quote]Oh, I thought you meant that these were all current laws.

They are, laws cannot really be undone once put into effect, but they can stop enforcing them. For example, in Michigan, the state I am in for the next year, It is illegal for a women to cut her hair, unless she has her husbands permission. No, it is not enforced anymore, but it is a current law, that if someone brought up on their wife, they would have to enforce it. It is just not publicly done unless brought up.[/quote]Ever heard of repealing?

EDIT: Even at the top of the page, the author says:

I suspect some have been repealed, and a few may even be fictional, but I have no direct knowledge, so please don't take them too seriously - this is not a law manual!

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid USA Laws
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:14, topic:343705”][quote]New York:

  1. A fine of $25 can be levied for flirting. This old law specifically prohibits men from turning around on any city street and looking “at a woman in that way.” A second conviction for a crime of this magnitude calls for the violating male to be forced to wear a “pair of horse-blinders” wherever and whenever he goes outside for a stroll.
    2. Jumping off a building is punishable by death (this includes the Empire State building). [Thanks to Chrisi C for that and to Georgina for a correction to the wording]
  2. It is illegal to shoot a rabbit from a moving trolley. [Thanks to Jacob Egloff][/quote]
    I lol’d[/quote]

Same, but what I want to know, is would they really do it. Or is this another one of the forgotten ones, like in Washington, the lollipops being banned.

Read full topic

I live in Washington, and I know none of those are real laws.

Do you know none of them are real, or is it the fact they are not enforced anymore. Most of the laws on that list are just not enforced anymore, but are real laws.

http://www.ahajokes.com/laws047.html
From just ‘streaming’ around, I found another one, with even the lollipop law.

Another, with even more Washington laws.
http://www.pugetsoundoff.org/blog/kat/4387

Please, I would get a list of current Washington laws before accusing this. Every state has stupid laws. Just because you live there, and have done some of them, does not mean its not illegal, its just that it is not enforced anymore.
[/quote]Oh, I thought you meant that these were all current laws.[/quote]

They are, laws cannot really be undone once put into effect, but they can stop enforcing them. For example, in Michigan, the state I am in for the next year, It is illegal for a women to cut her hair, unless she has her husbands permission. No, it is not enforced anymore, but it is a current law, that if someone brought up on their wife, they would have to enforce it. It is just not publicly done unless brought up.

item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Yes, some of them in the list are from the 1700’s even, but some of these, you just want to test. As for, I forget what state (I believe Texas), you cannot flick a booger into the wind.

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid USA Laws
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

hahaha!

here are some good ones:

Pennsylvania:

It is illegal to sing in the bathtub. [Thanks to Amanda]
In the Mount Pocono region any group of 5 or more Native Americans are to be considered a raiding party and may be killed on the spot.

Oregon:

You must let your dishes drip dry.

Rhode Island:

Any marriage where either of the parties is an idiot or lunatic is null and void.

South Dakota

No horses are allowed into Fountain Inn unless they are wearing pants.
It is illegal to lie down and fall asleep in a cheese factory.
If three or more Indians are walking down the street together, they can be considered a war party and fired upon.

Washington:

All lollipops are banned.
In Bellingham it is illegal for a woman to take any steps that are not in the backwards direction while dancing.

West Virginia:

No children may attend school with their breath smelling of “wild onions”

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid USA Laws
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Mr Mopar, post:2, topic:343705”][quote author=. link=topic=440096.msg3233946#msg3233946 date=1276326297]
Florida:

  1. Women may be fined for falling asleep under a hair dryer, as can the salon owner.
  2. A special law prohibits unmarried women from parachuting on Sunday or she shall risk arrest, fine, and/or jailing.
  3. If an elephant is left tied to a parking meter, the parking fee has to be paid just as it would for a vehicle.
  4. (SARASOTA) It is illegal to sing in a public place while attired in a swimsuit.
  5. Men may not be seen publicly in any kind of strapless gown.
  6. In Miami, it is forbidden to imitate an animal. [Thanks to Dave Knott]
  7. It is illegal to fart in a public place after 6:00pm on a Thursday. [Thanks to John Andrews]
  8. It is illegal to have sexual intercourse with a porcupine. [Thanks to Allison Neely]
  9. It is illegal for a woman to bungie jump naked on Sunday before midday. [Thanks to Danny Giffen]
  10. In Miami it is illegal to park your elephant on 8th Street on Sundays after 1pm. [Thanks to Diana E. Lopez]
  11. It’s illegal to purchase alcohol before 1pm on Sundays in the city of Coral Gables. [Thanks to Diana E. Lopez]
    [/quote]
    -.-[/quote]

Those are not even the worst. Pennsylvania has one that makes it legal to kill Native Americans IF they are in a crowd of 5 or more. As well, Texas has something about a horse and $100 being given to you when you get out of prison. Another one has something similar, but its a horse and a shotgun if you ask for it.

Read full topic
